other_tests.findings: Complete right bundle branch block (CRBBB) and normal QT interval (QTc, 435 ms); severe bradycardia (junctional rhythm HR, 30 bpm) with prolonged QT interval (QTc, 480 ms) and repetitive torsade de pointes (TdP); exaggerated QT prolongation by pacing (QTc, 731 ms); normal sinus rhythm with CRBBB and normal QT interval (QTc, 417 ms) after 6 days drug-free; QT prolonged during exercise testing (QTc increased from 408 to 457 ms)
other_tests.changes_over_time: QT interval was substantially shortened the next day after drug withdrawal (QTc, 594 ms) and normalized at the sixth day (QTc, 417 ms)

other_tests.findings: Novel missense mutation (L1825P) identified within the C-terminus region of the cardiac Na/H11001 channel (SCN5A)
Normal left ventricular function and normal coronary arteries.
